claude_code_instructions.time_constraint: NONE - Take as long as needed to achieve excellence
claude_code_instructions.philosophy:
This landing page represents Blockd's first impression to potential customers. Every pixel, every animation, every interaction must demonstrate the same level of technical sophistication that Blockd brings to interview security. We are not building a "good enough" page - we are building an Awwwards-worthy experience that developers will screenshot and designers will study.
Quality over speed. Excellence over expedience.
If a component requires 10 iterations to get right, do 10 iterations. If an animation needs frame-by-frame tuning, tune every frame. If a visualization needs custom shaders, write custom shaders.

quality_checkpoints.checkpoint: Before coding any major component, create a design mockup in Figma to validate the visual approach. Share the design for conceptual approval before implementation.
Before implementing complex animations, prototype them in Framer to validate timing, easing, and feel. Animation is where "good" becomes "exceptional."
After building each section, test it in a real browser. Take screenshots. Verify against the specifications. Iterate until perfect.
Run Lighthouse audit. Score should be 90+ on all metrics. Test on mobile devices. Test reduced motion preferences. Verify all accessibility requirements are met.

project_overview.name: Blockd - The Evidence Room

layers.layer: Dashed rectangle indicating screen area Color: #CBD5E1 at 30% Stroke: 2px dashed
Gaussian blur heat points Each point: position (x,y), duration (affects radius), timestamp
Labels for off-screen zones, pattern indicators

heat_rendering.point_algorithm: For each gaze point: 1. Draw circle at (x, y) position 2. Radius based on dwell time (longer = larger) 3. Apply Gaussian blur (20-40px based on radius) 4. Use additive blending for overlapping points

normal_interview.description: 500-800 gaze points, mostly within screen bounds. Natural wandering pattern, occasional off-screen (2-3 events). Clusters around center and relevant screen areas.

suspicious_interview.description: 500-800 gaze points with systematic left-to-right patterns. Frequent off-screen glances (14+ events). Clear reading pattern indicating looking at something off-screen.

final_notes.quality_expectations:
This landing page must be exceptional. It's the first impression for a sophisticated technical product, and every detail matters. When in doubt, choose the option that demonstrates more technical sophistication and attention to detail.
The goal is not to ship quickly—it's to ship something that would make both designers and developers impressed. Something that could be featured on Awwwards or shared in design communities as an example of excellent work.
final_notes.iteration_guidance:
Don't hesitate to iterate. If the first version of a component doesn't feel right, rebuild it. If an animation feels off, tune it until it's perfect. The specification provides direction, but the implementation requires craft and judgment.
When working on visualizations, take time to make them feel alive and authentic. The gaze heatmap should feel like real data. The risk gauge should feel weighty and meaningful. Small details compound into exceptional experiences.
final_notes.tool_encouragement: Use Figma MCP to design before coding complex components. Use Framer MCP to prototype animations before implementing them. Use browser testing to verify everything works as expected. Install any package that would improve the quality of the result. Take whatever time is needed to achieve excellence.
final_notes.success_criteria: The landing page is successful when: 1. A technical founder would immediately understand Blockd's value 2. A designer would screenshot it for inspiration 3. A developer would want to inspect how it was built 4. A potential customer would trust Blockd based on the quality shown 5. The page feels sophisticated, trustworthy, and technically impressive
final_notes.contact_for_questions: If any part of this specification is unclear or seems contradictory, use best judgment to resolve it in the direction of higher quality. The specification is a guide, not a constraint on excellence.
